artifact_name: cup type a(?); cup type c(?)
Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup of type A or C; interior: reserved band at top of lip and glazed black (heavily accreted) below; exterior: dilute band at top of rim; below, incompetent black-figure decoration consisting of upper part of figure with probably added red on hair or helmet and added white baldric, to left; vines in field.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, the figure is probably female, possibly an Amazon with a helmet. The decoration is perhaps in the manner of the Haimon Painter. Venit also suggests that the sherd may be by the same hand as British Museum 1965,0930.781.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 450, no. B749)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0641) (Phase 1)
